page.title: 03St. Oswald's church
page.content: St. Oswald's Old Church, according to available records, was first dedicated in 1349, though a survey made by Dr. Eric Gee some years ago revealed that it was built in about 1150, the first Norman church in this area. It continued to serve its parishioners until the present parish church was built in 1866 and it was finally declared redundant in 1973, when the costs of maintaining it became too great. At that time, however, an application was made to convert the church into a private home. Work began almost immediately, with care being taken to preserve the atmosphere of the original church. The graveyard was cleared and the tombstones were erected around the perimeter wall.
